text: Oh my gosh <@U6NFPDBV1> - I can't even imagine what that must've been like! What was it like??? The other band that I so wish to see is the band, Caspian, someday in concert. Or This Will Destroy You as well. :crossed_fingers:

text: I did the post rock thing hard for a while. One of my favourite gigs ever was Explosions in the Sky, where they played with no visuals and a dodgy guitar amp, and still were amazing

text:
Gybe was an interesting show for sure, there was literally no audience interaction. They went on, played for like 90 minutes without saying a word, and left. But despite that it's one of the best concerts I've ever been to. Hard to describe tbh, I'd probably use the word "surreal" though. 

And totally agree on Caspian and twdy, the latter especially is one of my favourite bands. 

Also I saw Mogwai too, I picked a good time to live in the UK :joy:

elements.text:
Gybe was an interesting show for sure, there was literally no audience interaction. They went on, played for like 90 minutes without saying a word, and left. But despite that it's one of the best concerts I've ever been to. Hard to describe tbh, I'd probably use the word "surreal" though. 

And totally agree on Caspian and twdy, the latter especially is one of my favourite bands. 

Also I saw Mogwai too, I picked a good time to live in the UK
